orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent reports and produce a final PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownwards planner that achieves both agents' goals while keeping actions of different agents distinct.

public_information: There are six action schemas: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted.
Each action has explicit preconditions and deterministic add/delete effects that manipulate binary predicates such as hand, cats, texture, vase, next, sneeze, stupendous, collect, spring.
Some actions set next relations between objects and some actions toggle vase and next facts.
Objects are opaque tokens named object_0 ... object_13 in the scenario.
Plans may be partial and agents may have overlapping or complementary knowledge of initial facts.

analysis.system_prompt: You are agent_A with local observations and a local plan. Produce a concise structured report describing: the initial facts you observe, the actions you consider applicable (with the relevant preconditions you can verify), which effects your planned actions would produce locally, and any uncertainties or missing facts that would prevent execution. Do not produce PDDL. Keep the report factual and machine-readable.
analysis.prompt: Your name is agent_A. Here is the public information: {environment->public_information}. Here is your private information: {agents->agent_A->private_information}. Here is your goal: {agents->agent_A->goal}. Produce a concise structured report of what you know about applicability of actions and the feasibility of your local plan and list any missing facts you require from others.

analysis.system_prompt: You are agent_B with local observations and possible options. Produce a concise structured report describing: the initial facts you observe, actions you deem applicable, the intended outcomes relevant to your goal, and any missing or ambiguous facts. Do not produce PDDL. Keep the report factual and machine-readable.
analysis.prompt: Your name is agent_B. Here is the public information: {environment->public_information}. Here is your private information: {agents->agent_B->private_information}. Here is your goal: {agents->agent_B->goal}. Produce a concise structured report of what you know about applicability of actions, how they affect local facts, and what you need to achieve the goal.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent planning who must produce a single PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownwards planner that integrates the agents' reports. Keep agent-specific actions distinct by prefixing or otherwise namespacing action names to indicate their originating agent. Provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encode the available action schemas (paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted) and the combined initial state and goal. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain> and </domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem> and </problem> tags. Ensure the PDDL is compatible with FastDownwards requirements (STRIPS-style typing if needed, clear initial and goal sections).
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive two structured reports from agents: {pddl->report_agent_A} and {pddl->report_agent_B}. Your task is to integrate these reports and produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeting the FastDownwards planner that achieves the combined goals: {agents->agent_A->goal} and {agents->agent_B->goal}. Keep actions of different agents distinct and resolve naming mismatches if necessary. If some facts are uncertain, encode them conservatively (do not assume unknown facts true). Provide the final PDDL domain and problem and label them with <domain>...</domain> and <problem>...</problem>.
